subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|門}} ''(Note: Some derived characters of ''<big>鬥</big>'' have {{w|Variant Chinese character|alternative forms}} that have been simplified to contain ''{{l|mul|門}}''. Example: ''{{l|mul|鬪}} and {{l|mul|闘}})

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} — two men fight with fists. Some oracle script characters of {{lang|zh|鬥}} show that both of their hair are bristled.

{{lang|zh|鬥}} and {{lang|zh|鬭}} are original characters of this form; all others are later corruptions.

Simplified form {{zh-l|*斗}} is via the variant form {{zh-l|*鬦}}.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Conflation of two roots "to fight" and "to meet", and the merger has been attested since ancient times.

; "to fight"
: Probably from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*daw||to defy, interfere, be at enmity with}}, which is the source of {{cog|bo|སྡོ||to bear up against, bid defiance}} and {{cog|my|တော့||to resent an insinuation, interfere in a quarrel}}.

; "to meet"
: {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} considers this cognate with {{och-l|注|to apply; to be touched; to bring together; to join}}; see there for more.
